ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed a broad understanding of what constitutes research and the time and energy that goes into it. Also learned a lot of new laboratory techniques and how to properly carry out experimentation when looking at a hypothesis.
I learned how to design and conduct an independent research project, and I learned important analytical skills in R.
I learned a lot of wet-lab information, scientific inquiry, and how to concisely convey complex, scientific information.
how to conduct scientific research
RESEARCH SKILLZ \_(  )_/
Learned numerous research skills in my lab. The professors provide helpful guidelines and structure for assignments.
How to think, analyze, and present like a scientist.
How to design a project, use various laboratory techniques, analyze data, and write a research paper.
Bettered my wet lab experience.
Developed ability to design and execute a research project.
Individualized and independent research in a lab
I learned how to design and execute a research plan, how to present a scientific finding, and how to work in a lab.
Lab work! How to print a poster and write a full research paper on my work!
Lab skills
good research skills
Lab skills relevant to my senior research project, as well as how to assemble and present a research poster, give a timed research talk and write a scientific paper discussing my project.
I learned how to complete a scientific project and be part of a true lab within the scientific community, as well as write a well written and formatted report to explain my findings.
I gained the ability to complete research and lead a project!
I really improved my research skills

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths -- learned a lot, loved the format where you are learning under a PI

Weaknesses -- the last week of class is horrible. PLEASE don't make next year have their thesis due, thesis presentation due, and thesis poster symposium all within the same week. That was horrible to have on top of all other classes.

Strengths: independent work, ability to interact with mentor/PI and learn in a rigorous research setting
Weaknesses: lack of structure in the course; it might be nice to have a mid-semester check-in with other students taking the course, so that we can share our research progress and get feedback from our peers.

Strength: the autonomy is great 
Weakness: communication surrounding the expectations for each portion of the project (paper, poster, presentation) was disorganized and sent late.

it really just depends on how your lab functions. In regards to this course, improvement could be made in actually providing support for students in their labs. For one thing, requiring that students have a printed poster of sorts for the final presentation, but no funding from the department is kinda laughable. Additionally, the deadines for some of the assignments were so unclear and not communicated throughout the semester, only during the last week.
Might be nice to have a bit more communications between the faculty and students just to make sure students are on-track, but overall the course was really great!
I thought it was a great senior research course - I can see the overall evaluation depending on your lab environment, mentor, and PI.
couldve had food at the presentations
This course was a wonderful opportunity to get experience in research, and I learned so much.

Lots of stuff is backloaded, was a bit stressful near the end. Also MCDB has no funding for posters. It is actually quite classist that they require us to come up with a poster but yet provide no funding--many labs do not fund a poster, and so then the cost is on the student. It is possible to just print sheets of paper but those do not look nearly as nice, and your poster looks 2nd rate for something that's not your fault. If MCDB is not providing funding, they should not require the poster session, ESPECIALLY since there is already an oral presentation the same week.
Would be nice to have more detailed instructions regarding the thesis components. Deadlines and details about final paper, presentation, and poster were lacking.
I liked how it was independent and you could choose what type of research you wanted to do
More flexibility for unexpected circumstances would be nice! My lab members were great but I sometimes felt unsupported by the professors running this class
I wish that we had received more feedback throughout the semester and had clearer communication regarding expectations and deadlines
Poor consistency from PI to PI.
The main weakness would be the number of assignments: a written report AND oral presentation AND a poster? I think two of those three would have been more appropriate

A weakness of this course was the layout of the final week. I think that the oral presentations should have occurred in early April, like they were supposed to, so that the workload was more spread out. Because it wasn't spread out, my lab had me doing benchwork until the Friday before the final week of classes, leaving me very little time to prepare my presentation, poster, and paper. Additionally, requiring the paper to be turned  in at 4 pm when you ran the poster session from 2-4 pm the same day was the worst idea you could've possibly had. The syllabus does stated the the paper would be due at 5 pm so having it be due not only earlier, but right at the end of the poster session was inconsiderate. Make them due on separate days, or at the very least, separate times.
The assignments being back loaded was hard, so maybe changing things around a little

More communication from course coordinators about upcoming deadlines/dates and dont make the paper and poster due on the same day (especially not the last day of classes, the week before the last day would be better.)

Your enjoyment of the course does depend on your PI and the lab you choose, so you should choose wisely. Also, there is very little guidance and checkpoints outside of your lab (ie. from the course administrators or the MCDB registrar) so it is up to you, your mentor, and your PI to ensure you are on track. You need to communicate with your peers and manage your time wisely, or you will be a bit screwed. I do sometimes wish there were more enforceable checkpoints to make sure you were making good progress, but it is difficult to enforce given the nature of the senior thesis.

Strengths include the oral presentation and opportunity to complete year-long research. Reports were also a helpful way of consolidating research. It could be good if funding was provided for poster printing.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. You learn a lot about the scientific world, as well as yourself, when you're figuring out how to carry out research to the best of your abilities.
I would recommend this to anyone who needs research.

if you're not committed to research maybe consider the alternative option of just taking additional upper level electives and avoiding the research route. Also, make sure to communicate with your lab if you do decided to pursue the research route. I honestly should have taken the BS intensive version as i ended up spending close to 20-25+ hours a week in the lab (so just make sure to communicate your goals and intentions as well as boundaries to research mentors when deciding which MCDB class you want to take for the degree requirement)
yeee you have to take it if u want the BS.
Yes--very nice way to wrap up Yale!

It's required to graduate! You will get what you want out of it. Definitely approach with a positive attitude. I was very fortunate to be in an incredible lab that fostered a very positive atmosphere and emphasized growth mindset.

Yes, I would recommend this course for MCDB seniors. Although it is a lot of work, I learned so much throughout the year, and having the opportunity to carry out my own project with the support of my mentor and members of my lab was very rewarding.
You have to take it for MCDB, so irrelevant.
This is your thesis... you need to do it.
Yeah, if you like research and want to create your own schedule
Yes  you need to take this anyways, and its great experience to figure out if you want to pursue lab research in the future.
Required.
Yes a wonderful opportunity to engage in independent research and feel proud of the project you undertake
This is a thesis course so you need to take it to graduate from this major...
senior? yes
Yes, great way to gain scientific research experience and learn how to write scientific papers and give research talks/presentations.
You have to take this course to get a B.S. in MCDB. Otherwise, if you don't like doing work in a lab, you may not have the best time. However, it does depend on the lab you choose.
Yes, I would recommend, because the course is very enjoyable and research experience gained is valuable.
